job_title: Mental Health Technician in Walnutport, PA
pros: Work you feel good about
cons: MHTs do almost all client interaction while the rest of the staff sit downstairs shopping, watching movies, doing homework etc. Clients can get violent and there isn't enough staff.

review_title: They don’t care about their patients
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Walnutport, PA
pros: Decent insurance. You can eat the food there. You got 40 hours and there was always optional overtime
cons: The patients are treated poorly. They are only allowed to go out once a week and it’s to a crappy dollar store. They eat terribly and all they do is lay around as a result. The program is intended to keep them there. You do not make a difference. Every suggestion you make is tossed by the higher ups. No chance for advancements. They pick favorites. Some people will be thirty minutes late consistently and others will get in trouble for being five minutes late

review_title: Toxic work environment, unfair pay, shady practices
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Frankford, PA
pros: depending on where you work, can be a laid back environment but with less structure residents/clients tend to become more disorganized and distressed
cons: unfair pay, more responsibilities than what is listed in job description, lack of support from management, lack of coworkers to help out. Many employees are sexist, racist, abelist or homophobic.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Good employees who will assist you
cons: bad management will want to leave

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Flexible schedule to work; you can manage your own schedule
cons:
No changes to grow
Paperwork is insane

review_title: Decent benefits but overall a hot mess
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Philadelphia, PA
pros: I found the pay and benefits to be pretty decent. I think I started with 4 weeks PTO and the pay was competitive.
cons: No support when things went haywire. Found myself as the only nurse after my colleague quit suddenly... forced to work 80 hours/week for several months. Then found myself in a battle to try to block a potential new resident who was known to be quite violent. I lost the battle, he moved in and I got beat up almost immediately. That was the last straw for me, and quite honestly I hung on far too long

review_title: Not a good place to work
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Patients/clients are a joy to work with.
cons: Administration is very unorganized with complete disregard for staff concerns.

pros: Will take inexperienced staff and will train you.
cons: Pay can be dependent upon whether clients show and no pay for support hours.

pros: Good benefits/clients are like family
cons: Work life balance can become a bit complicated.

pros: Some of the staff were wonderful to work with and truly cared about the clients.
cons: Low wage, not a lot of support for professional development and burn-out prevention, takes several years to get good time off benefits

review_title: Resigned After One and a Half Year
job_title: Mental Health Tech II in Walnutport, PA
pros: Rewarding by assisting behavioral residents with difficulties.
cons: Poor Management, Low Wages, Seven colleagues of mine have quit since I have been working for this company. Never call off, Always performed my job requirements and usually went the extra mile, Personable with the residents and colleagues and when this writer informed management that this writer applied for a full-time position this writer was told that they are looking at other applicants.

pros: Good pay for part time workers and had good benefits
cons: Kinda condescending sometimes but overall it’s cool

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Walnutport, PA

pros: Good company, great people nice job
cons: The neighborhood is not the best

pros: COMHAR Org. It is a great Mental Health agency that provides recovery treatments to those most vulnerable individuals in our society. It was an honor to work with them, I very thankful for the opportunity I had to build the successful "Art and Recovery" program for them.
cons: Teaching art as education and integration tool is been proved very effective in my experience, I had applied my art curricula to different schools, community centers, and mental health agencies with excellent results, I am certain that I can reply this success training other teachers how to apply this art education system.

review_title: Management is very unprofessional and mean.
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Taking care of the client. Team work with co workers.
cons: Managements is inconsiderate  of  your personal time off. Also, management do not follow their own policy. Also, management will make a schedule and not have full coverage leaving workers to work a double shift. Also management will lie and put their name on the schedule and they never showed up to work,so ratio to staff and client is off. Also, management will speak to workers like we our their children not an employees for the company.

review_title: Competitive benefits and salary within the field.
pros: Workplace culture facilitates on-going training and improvement.  Company shows a marked preference for hiring and promoting within which leads to multiple paths of advancement.  I am aware of several instances when managers have worked with employees on altering their schedule to accommodate opportunities for additional education.
cons: Scheduling can be a challenge but for the most part management will work with you and has open lines of communication.

job_title: Mental Health Tech II in Walnutport, PA
pros: Security with 3 to 4 staff /8 residents ratio.
cons: Due to Staffing Agency dominating middle and night shift ratio,made for horrible company hired staff,including upper level was intimidated.

pros: Many hours available to work; as long as you are able to get "cases" assigned to you.
cons: The job politics can be a pain ..and working with the administration. Staff is frustrating at times. It feels like the company is so separated

job_title: Patient Registrar in Gulf Shores, AL
pros: health insurance 401k positive working atmosphere among co-workers

job_title: Urgent Care RN in Gulf Shores, AL

job_title: Registered Nurse, MedSurg in Foley, AL
pros:
People you work with are like family. Usually everyone gets along. Open door policy with management if you have issues or concerns.
WOW positions
3 days a week considered FT with options to pick up OT. 
Nurse to patient: 1 to 5 on day shift and night shift is 1 to 6
Some floors have self scheduling
You get a lot of skills.
Cafeteria food is cheap
clinical ladder with pay increases along with your yearly raises.
Small hospital so you get to know everyone in each department(usually).
Their is other things but I cannot remember at the moment
cons:
Pay sucks for the amount of work that has to be completed/expected. 
Triple charting with the outdated system. 
Not easy to transfer to other departments. Some people get accepted into a position and 6-12 months still waiting to get out of the department.
No IV team you have to call someone from ICU/PCU/ER/Outpatient and not guaranteed someone is able to do it for you because they other duties to do.
Management has a staff grid to determine the amount of staff to come in and it does not include patient acuity. 
We now have resident doctors for night shift that call the shots when a actual MD is on call if they need them.(sketchy)
CNO doesn’t keep her word on some issues when promised something.
HR has zero compassion for the employees when questions are asked or need help. 
You rarely get out on time due to charting.
HCAHPS scoring system
Their is other things but I cannot remember at the moment.

pros: Most people are nice. Small local hospital so most people know one another. Physicians are very nice for the most part
cons: The pay is HORRIBLE. The hospital has major growing pains which are not being managed properly. The only way to have a bonus or pay raise is to work over time. No retention bonus for employees who have worked so hard. New grads make more then the nurses who have been there long term

pros: Works great with family work balances
cons: Not enough staff to get the work done

pros: Great learning environment for students
cons: Staffing is always short, tech work is not a great time

pros: Great benefits, great retirement. Relatively easy to work for.
cons: Occasional moving around faculties unexpectedly

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Foley, AL

pros: Great, fun, and supportive cowokers, educational help, moving up in career,

pros: Decent Pay, Co-Workers, Work Pace

review_title: Fast pace. You may start off doing postpartum then switch to labor, and then over to medserge all in one day.
pros: Most of the people you work with are friendly and helpful. Most of the Doctors are pleasant. And , our current unit manager has made many positive improvements to the unit.
cons: Low pay. No bonuses given. Time to rotate upper management out to another hospital and bring in fresh minds open to new ideas. To much of the "GOOD O BOY" mentality.

pros: Decent pay for the area, working with GI doctors is excellent
cons: Hospital's reputation locally was dour. I never did figure that out but folks in the area spoke of it as "even if I am dying, don't take me there."  Our department was highly competent. Attrition in management and hiring within people who were unqualified.

pros: Absolute wonderful staff! Along with hours and benefits were also very good. I was able to learn so much working with some of the most experience woman! They were all so kind and very intelligent!
cons: To be honest the only bad thing I can say was that I hate that I had to leave. I didn't want to let that job go. It was an awesome job and had room to move u! However I was pregnant with my first born and decide to stay home with her!

pros:
Very nice coworkers "outside" of the lab.
A few exceptions in the lab too.
Not much else unfortunately
cons:
Excessively cruel  management with little to no "People" skills.
Don't call in sick or your hours will be cut the next week.
Manager who belittles and will complain in public about any tiny shortcoming of her staff.
NO praise when you do a good job.
Had to post my own recognition with NO response from the manager,twice.
